intro: Doronicum grandiflorum proles ambiguum, commonly known as the ambiguous large-flowered leopard's bane, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It features upright, branching stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive red or orange throat, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained, moist soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats.
